report.title: Showing Me My Place in the Universe
report.author: Triode
report.bodytext: Two good friends and I decided to take a weekend and trip on DOB. My /n initial expectations were of a trip very much like 2C-B, but spanning /n sixteen to twenty hours and fueled by the presence of amphetamine. /n What occurred was something not entirely different, but not something /n I'd been anticipating. /n /n [T+0h] Saturday noon. After I munched on a breafast of bacon and eggs, /n we three wanderers each ingest 2.5mg DOB dissolved in distilled water. /n Mixed with orange juice; taste imperceptible. Here goes. /n /n [T+0:30] First twinges of a psychedelic drug in my system. /n /n [T+0:45] The psychedelic is clearly taking over my brain. Interacting /n with the world around me is difficult. If I know nothing else, it's /n that I'd better get the hell outta public view. /n /n [T+1h] Two of the three of us arrive at a Safe location. We have a /n friend who'd volunteered to drive us around that weekend, and so we /n wait for him to get ready to take us home. We step inside (out of the /n sunlight) and immediately my field of vision explodes into /n characteristically 2C-B visuals. I notice as well a wave of /n amphetamine crash over my body, and I am soon feeling like the /n strongest man alive. I help my chauffeur lug some very heavy cargo to /n the van -- effortless. This shit is SPEEDY. I am smoking pot because /n I am compulsed towards it; it seems like a good idea to head off any /n GI discomfort at the pass. /n /n [T+1:30] We two arrive at home and meet the third, who's been coming /n up on the same schedule. At this point, when I am in a darkened area, /n I am completely unable to distinguish visual effects from real /n objects. Amphetamine high is still CRUISING. /n /n [T+2h] I am so amped, I could gnaw the head off a puppy. Fortunately, /n the fact that my entire perspective is moving, breathing, pulsating, /n billowing, and crawling keeps me from doing anything useful. More /n smoking, and it is noticeably hard to keep it together long enough to /n pack a bowl. I am floored. /n /n [T+2:30] I am thanking my lucky stars that I am going to have to /n interact only with people I know very well for the next 20 hours. I /n am quite sure that I am having a good time, though -- still feels like /n 2C-B, but HARDER. /n /n [T+3h] I would trade a kidney for a pack of Bazooka gum. I have been /n becoming more and more disoriented with my surroundings throughout the /n whole three hours, and it is here that I would call myself 'lost' in /n my own house. /n /n [T+4h] A delightful, non-tripping-his-eyeballs-out friend shows up, /n and we three enjoy talking to him. I think it is at this point that /n the trip begins its second leg; the 2C-B visuals start to fade (very /n slightly, at this point) and get the hell out of the way, and a very /n profound, intellectual DOB experience begins. /n /n [T+4:20] I pack a bowl. 'See you in 12 hours, guys.' *rrrrrrrip* /n /n [T+5h] I can feel a slight tension lifted from my body as I /n simultaneously feel my brain kick into high gear. I eat something /n because I can somehow tell I need to. /n /n [T+6h] Over T+5-6h, I am able to clear the visuals out of the way /n (although they're still _very_ strong) and think, think, think. I /n suddenly questioned every fact about reality I'd taken for granted. /n /n [T+7h] The amphetamine din has settled into a dull roar, and I am /n leading my appreciative brain through an odyssey of metaphysically- /n deep insights into the real and perceived worldview I call 'Reality', /n leaving open at every corner the chance for anything to be possible. /n The three of us are happily and hungrily announcing and discussing our /n current thoughts. We are settling down into a dark room in the middle /n of our house, almost like a cocoon, each person in turn putting on the /n music he believed to be perfect for the situation. /n /n [T+9h] We are devouring any knowledge we can, eager to share our /n amazing experiences and contemplations. We eat when we need food, /n drink when we need water, smoke when it feels right. I feel as though /n I'm overseeing my body at a higher level than I ever have; I have a /n good and innate sense of how to take care of myself (food, water, /n pot, music) without dwelling on the individual feelings and pains in /n my body. It is apparent that the 'peak' (T+1-8h) has passed and the /n effects are beginning a very slow, gradual taper. Three non-tripping /n friends appear, and it is very comforting to see faces from the /n outside world. We talk and enjoy each other. /n /n [T+12h] Less visual, more brainy! DOB thoughts are leaving me /n dumbfounded. I am anxious to wrap my brain around any scenario I can /n conceive. I have a correct and instinctual understanding of /n electricity and magnetism, quantum mechanics, thermodynamics, organic /n chemistry, algorithmic mathematics in such a way that I can simply /n 'feel' in what trend a particular system will act. By possessing this /n deep understanding of physics and mathematics, the rules of my /n universe, I can detect patterns shared among wildly different systems /n (the ties that bind between social, chemical, and physical /n interactions). I cook pasta for the six of us, and as it is /n well-received I ponder the satisfaction of crafting something for my /n friends and having it appreciated. /n /n It's interesting to note that this experience was more what I would /n call 'Ecstasy' than MDMA is. My past drug experiences were /n embarrassed and belittled by the DOB's gravity, its unique /n characteristic of allowing me to invent a constant stream of Heavy /n Shit for my mind to happily plow through. I felt like I'd never /n thought about anything so important; my most fundamental concepts of /n reality were shaken to the core for the first time, and in comparison /n it makes the visceral high of a 'quality' MDMA or mushroom trip seem /n positively rude. Whereas MDMA might allow me to reach a comfortable /n synergy with the people around me, DOB provided a glimpse of what it /n might be like to achieve Nirvana, to exist as pure thought. When it /n comes right down to it, this is why I ingest psychedelics. This is /n what it's all about. /n /n I had some very momentous insights into heritage and family ties, from /n my relationship with my dad to my kinship with the creatures from /n which I evolved. I was given a chance to grasp the infinity of the /n universe; understanding its specifics was clearly out of reach, but I /n understood why it was acting how it was acting, on the whole. DOB is /n completely orthogonal to the emotional realm; it does not alter my /n mood at all, and only allows me to enjoy it because I enjoy thinking. /n /n [T+14h] 2am Sunday, and it is here that things really begin to screech /n to a halt. Our conversation becomes less frequent, and I become more /n introspective. It's time to let the music take over. /n /n [T+16:20] 4:20am and I'm keeping true to the previous afternoon's /n promise. We are content to keep ourselves warm, hydrated and fed, and /n bathed in music. Very faint visuals. Coming down, no question about it. /n /n [T+20h] It is around this point in time when each of us three dozes /n off in turn; we're right on the tail end of the DOB's effects. /n /n [T+22h] At 10am Sunday, I declared the DOB's mental effects 'over'. /n /n [T+33h] After a full day of doing stuff and feeling generally ok, it's /n sleepytime. :) /n /n DOB tore me a new asshole. I cannot describe it without its power /n making itself apparent in my speech; DOB will forever hold a special /n place in my heart, a place earned as a Truly Psychedelic Drug. If /n treated with respect, I believe DOB can show us how awesome the /n human condition can be.
